Package ohos.powermanager

Class PowerManager.RunningLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.powermanager.PowerManager.RunningLock
  • Enclosing class:
    PowerManager

    public final class PowerManager.RunningLock
extends Object
    Provides a mechanism to prevent the system from hibernating so that the applications can run in the background or when the screen is off.

    PowerManager#createRunningLock(String, RunningLockType) can be called to obtain a RunningLock.

    lock(long) can be called to set the lock duration, during which the system will not hibernate. After the lock duration times out, the lock is automatically released and the system hibernates if no other RunningLock is set.

    The following is an example of how to use RunningLock.

    @Step1: Obtain the PowerManager object, create a global RunningLock object for it, and set the RunningLockType. If the RunningLock object is damaged, the lock duration will become invalid.

    @Step2: Set a lock duration greater than 0 in milliseconds 

       PowerManager powerManager = new PowerManager();
   PowerManager.RunningLock runninglock = powerManager.createRunningLock("test",PowerManager.RunningLockType.BACKGROUND);
 
   runninglock.lock(5000);
    Since:
    1

      • lock

        public void lock​(long timeOutMs)
        Prevents the system from hibernating and sets the lock duration.
        Parameters:
        timeOutMs - Indicates the lock duration (ms). After the lock duration times out, the lock is automatically released and the system hibernates if no other RunningLock is set.

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed​()
        Checks whether a lock is held or in use.
        Returns:
